review_discussion.author: affeldt-aist
review_discussion.comment: `interval.v` introduced this convention of using `o` and `c` suffixes to talk about intervals.

review_discussion.author: thery
review_discussion.comment:
> `interval.v` introduced this convention of using `o` and `c` suffixes to talk about intervals.

could this be documented in the header?
when reading the name I thought about +oo and -oo :wink:

review_discussion.author: affeldt-aist
review_discussion.comment:
> Shouldn't we also add `oo_oc`, `oo_co`, `oc_cc` and `co_cc`?

Indeed. `subset_itv` is a more general lemma that subsumes all the variants but maybe we can keep the variants that are more readable?

commits.author: affeldt-aist
commits.message:
backport from mathcomp-analysis

- see https://github.com/math-comp/analysis/pull/385
